title: Things you CAN'T do in ARAM
body:
Yes, ARAM is a fun mode but that doesn't mean that you can do absolutely anything you want. And by that I mean things that make the game NOT FUN for your teammates like:
- Insulting, harassing, use of slurs. 
- Feeding in purpose all game. (no, i don't mean a couple of bad decisions of having a bad game, I mean going in purpose 1v5 without the team to die under their turret all game)
- Taking health relics in the faces of your teammates that need them when you are full health and mana just to piss them off.

You want to build AD Morgana? Go ahead. I have no problem with that. But I see the mentioned behavior quite too often and people reply things like "who cares this is ARAM."
Well no, you insult or say "%%%" or "n-word" or insult teammates? You get reported. Your attitude is negative all game just to piss off your teammates? You get reported.
ARAM is a fun mode. So if you make the game NOT FUN for your teammates with an unacceptable behavior, you shouldn't play this mode and you get reported.
That's all.

replies.body: When you say ''you're reported'' the most likely answer you'll get is something among the lines of '' i dont give a ~~****~~ ''
Until they do give a fuck and come to the boards complaining that they did nothing wrong to be banned and Riot posts the chat logs for us all to enjoy.

Yeah i totally enjoy those posts :)

But most of the times even if i'm not saying anything or doing anything wrong, i get flamed all game for the 1 mistake i did, and as i report them, i never get any kind of notification that the person ive reported has been punished, so most people dont care about reports...

I understand your feeling. I have reported MANY very serious things that were said in games and I only got one notification that a person I reported was punished. One, ever. 
I still want to believe my reports are useful. Even if I admit is kind of a blind faith.

That's why i want the tribunal back :(...

I want to punish the bad guys!
I think part of the tribunal will be that you don't get to vote on people you reported...

So what?

I can vote for bad guys that other good guys encounter, and the other good guys get to vote for my bad guys.

How is that a problem?

The mistake there would be to say "you're reported" (or "reproted", as is as frequent to see), instead of explaining to him what he did wrong and why, and based upon the manner of his reply decide whether or not to make a report out of it.
Dependng on the situation and offense done, obviously.

Have you ever tried reasoning with a person that's trolling/feeding?

They don't give a ~~****~~ about anyone reporting them since it can't be verified unless you got it on video.

No, and I don't bother with them: report with description, block and move on.
"Never argue with an idiot - they will drag you down to their level and beat you with experience" <- is what I think when I encounter a troll. That and "what a waste of space that person is...".

Enough people report that same person, and the video won't matter as the reports themselves serves as verification. Which is the whole point of the reports.
lol ''they will drag you down to their level and beat you with experience'' niiice
Whenever someone feeds or trolls I always mention how much worthless time they have if they bother trolling for 20 minutes on a computer game
Replace ARAM with Dominion/Twisted Treeline/One for all and it still works

One For All has been a pretty toxic experience for me. Afk/rage quit/dc, bitching...
I honestly don't play TT or Dominion but it makes me sad to hear that it is like that there too.

Things you SHOULDN'T do in ARAM:
-Don't roll a champion without asking first: there might be someone who wants Rammus, Evelynn or Nasus.
_Personal note: I keep the tank, even if I've just played 5 games of the same thing and am dead tired of it, if the team doesn't have another tank, and I can't trade._

-When you're going for a glyph, and there is another ally a bit further back, also wanting a glyph, you go for the glyph further down - don't be Draven (narcissistic) and just take the first one.
_Personal note: sharing is caring._

-Let the healer get the glyphs: if you're playing ADC, but low on HP, and the healer got full HP, but low on mana, the healer got priority.
If you're playing mage, and is low on both HP and mana, that's up to individual judgement. Just remember the healer/support cannot do anything without mana. The mages usually got Doran's Ring for mana regen, whereas the support doesn't have that.
_Personal note: I try to let the mages take the farm for mana regen through their Doran's._

Clarity becomes pretty pointless late game as tear or no tear, you tend to get over the mana problem late game But the tear then transition into an item that can deal quite a bit of damage once it transforms. I rather take ghost/flash since he has zero mobility and is useful at all points of the ARAM. 

But I do agree with the OP, do whatever the hell you want so long as it does SOMETHING. I played with an ADC syndra a few days ago in ARAM and honestly it was fricking hilarious.

Clarity is definitely not pointless late game. Obviously it is more handy at the beginning where it gives you a huge advantage to harass and sustain the harass. But even if you are a tank, once you have Warmogs and you can just retreat 10 seconds to recover your full health instead of dying, clarity keeps being handy to also sustain your mana for the long periods of time that you won't die.

To each his own, I can't recall ever running out of mana in recent memory in ARAM once I get later on in the game, I rarely fall even under half mana most cases. For me it serves next little purpose in the late game as oppose to ghost, flash, or exhaust, or even ignite with its grievious wounds if you're lucky enough to choose it into a team like mundo.

Think the only champion I ever take it on is Lux, who is a special case, considering how insane her mana costs are throughout the entire game.

I played poro king once against a suicide zyra. She'd just snowball into us, spam everything, die. We were all like, "Wtf is she even doing."

Then we got to post game and saw her with the most damage by a significant margin. That was a big "oh." moment.

Dealing the most damage doesn't mean you have played effectively for the team. If I am playing against a team with healers, it won't matter if I just go on my own and deal some damage to several champions before I die because they will just heal up and screw my team who are now 4v5.

This can be applied to Summoner's Rift.
Where have you been all these years?

On the health relics, its super obvious when they troll with those. I understand just kinda walking absentmindedly across them when they are down, and one pops up as you walk over it or miscommunications on who should take it, ive done that a bunch, but the people who just stand on them and do nothing else really ruin the match. I understand stealing the relics to troll a friend, but dont do it to random strangers lol.

Like someone taking a glyph when there is a low HP/mana Soraka on the team...I mean, really? Okay, I give them the benefit of the doubt the first time and tell them how my heals are way more effective than the glyphs. I ofc judge that situation individually. 
_Not everyone knows the glyphs spawn every 40 secs, and actually keeps track of that timer..._

Intentional feeding is easily spotted - no point in bothering with telling them why that's a bad idea. Let them have their fun, don't say anything to them except perhaps trading jokes with the enemy team to make the most of it, and report the feeder afterwards.
Flaming at such people just gives them what they want: attention.

Also, it may be just me, but I got a big thing with surrendering in ARAM. I am very much inclined to report a person for negative attitude if he plays a tank, goes 0/13/7, even if not on purpose and basically just gives up and starts spamming surrender votes.
He may not be having fun, and I can easily understand his frustration (we've all been in that situation at some point in that mode), but he made a commitment when queing up, and he stands responsible for doing his part on the team until the end screen.

As you said, AD Morgana is perfectly acceptable if they know what they're doing - if they don't, and just do it out of spite, aka "it's only ARAM", they should be reminded of the rules: put the team before yourself: "Enjoy Yourself, but not at Anyone Else's Expense".
Anyone go "it's only ARAM", I report them, regardless of what their offense is.

-----------

I played my ARAM match #5000 not too long ago, and so I have seen my fair share of different attitudes there.
As well as far too many people who just can't suck it up and play even if they get a..."a derp champion", I believe was the term. And so they just dodge instead. I prefer to go 2/15/5 with Evelynn instead of dodging if there is no other way. At least I get experience with her, both in playstyle and build, so as to perhaps not make the same mistakes again.
_After all, I did make the decision of unlocking her in the first place..._

I like to think this mentality could be beneficial for a lot of ARAM'ers.

No I do not report weird builds in ARAM as long as they are trying to actually play and win. Of course build someone AP with nothing that scales AP will get reported, or someone who just builds {{item:3117}}  {{item:3117}}  {{item:3117}}  {{item:3117}}  {{item:3117}}  {{item:3117}} 
But I've played ARAM just to have fun with different builds from AD Mao to tank Ashe and I'm ok with it. If it is not ARAM, where else?

Surrendering in ARAM is pretty lame too, especially in a mode that you easily get to level 18 and full build if you resist long enough even if the enemy team has been harassing you from the start. A bad ACE and you win the game. 
I've surrendered a couple of times but for good reasons like 3 afk and things like that.

dude aram is so crazy, its a fun mode... i had a team where we lost inhib and we were pushing to the enemy first turret, i was like "if we're losing, why the hell are we pushing?", my teammate said "idk, its aram"... other game the enemy aced us and only they're {{champion:51}}  survived, she started killing the nexus turrets, then moved on to the nexus...But the Troll King inhib respawned, it gave us enough time to revive, kill cait, win the next team fight (cait was still dead) and win the game ~~G to the f**king G~~

And who judges if they are actually trying to win? Yes, for someone experienced, you can easily tell if that person is actually trying or just unskilled or intentially feeding, but that is relative in many cases.

Like my 2/15/5 Evelynn game - yes, from my perspective, I did try, but I always got caught out of position as I didn't/still don't know how Evelynn works. I can easily see how I could be perceived as someone intentionally feeding.
It was quite odd, as I, in an attempt to stop dying, stayed at the backline, just trying to Q poke whenever I could, but then I was told "eve do something!!"...so I went back in again, and kept on dying.
I think I was playing full tank at the time, with Mountain, Locket and some other tank stuff, as the rest of the team was glass cannon mages/ADCs.

Needless to say, we lost that match.

My favorite joke build was when i built Tank Shaco.  Our team was all squishy damage dealers and was pretty even in regards of ad/ap damage.  I was the least necessary, so i was like fuck it, i am going to screw with the enemy.  It was hilarious, apparently none of them realized i was building tank, so everytime i appeared in the middle of their team they attempted to kill me, needless to say my team got so many kills and i actually was super disruptive and didn't even die that much.
